conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and pass through baffles to reach containers E, F, or G.

Container B is positioned next to A and releases liquid downward.
Container C is positioned next to B and releases liquid downward.
Container D is positioned at the top-right and releases liquid downward.
A black baffle is angled downward to the left below containers A and B.
A yellow baffle is angled downward to the center-right below container C.

Container E is green and positioned at the bottom-left.
Container F is red and positioned at the center-bottom.
Container G is white and positioned at the bottom-right.

conclusion: Liquid from A is directed toward the left side.

conclusion: Liquid from B is directed toward the left side.

conclusion: Liquid from A and B merge and flow leftward.

conclusion: Liquid from A and B enters container E.
